entry.title: Beginning My PhD Journey at UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦

link.title: Beginning My PhD Journey at UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦

entry.content:
A New Chapter in Montreal

After years of dedication, learning, and exploration in the fields of Artificial Intelligence and Software Engineering, Iâ€™m thrilled to announce that Iâ€™ve officially started my PhD at the UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al ðŸŽ‰. This marks a significant milestone in my professional and personal journey â€” one Iâ€™m incredibly excited and grateful for.

What makes this moment even more special is the opportunity to work under the supervision of two brilliant minds: Prof. Houari Sahraoui and Prof. Michalis Famelis. Both are internationally respected researchers in software engineering and have been driving forces behind advancements in model-driven engineering and formal reasoning.

Welcome to GEODES and DIRO

My research will take place within the GEODES lab at the DÃ©partement dâ€™Informatique et de Recherche OpÃ©rationnelle (DIRO). GEODES is known for its impactful work on software modeling, system design, and program analysis. The lab provides a stimulating and collaborative environment where innovation thrives at the intersection of theory and practice.

Being part of DIRO â€” one of the most renowned computer science departments in Canada â€” is both a privilege and a responsibility I take to heart.

My Research Focus

At the heart of my doctoral journey lies a question that keeps evolving with every major leap in AI:

How can we automate model-driven software design using Large Language Models (LLMs) and intelligent agents?

This is the core of my research: leveraging LLM-based agents to support and automate Model-Driven Engineering (MDE) tasks. From model synthesis and transformation to design validation and documentation, I aim to explore how modern LLMs can act as collaborative design agents in the software development lifecycle.

This ambitious direction bridges AI, Software Engineering, and Human-AI collaboration â€” and I couldnâ€™t think of a better academic ecosystem to pursue it.

First Impressions

Arriving in Montreal has been both exciting and humbling. The campus itself is beautiful â€” nestled at the foot of Mount Royal and buzzing with activity. The main building of UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al stands tall and majestic, a perfect reflection of the universityâ€™s academic strength and cultural significance.

And yes, I had to take that classic photo by the university logo â€” a memory Iâ€™ll hold onto as the beginning of a new era.

Whatâ€™s Next?

This is just the beginning. Over the coming months (and years), Iâ€™ll be diving deep into research, contributing to academic publications, collaborating with other labs, and sharing insights along the way.

Stay tuned for more updates â€” especially if youâ€™re curious about AI agents, software models, or just the everyday life of a PhD student in beautiful Montreal ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡¦.

If youâ€™re working on something similar or would like to connect, feel free to reach out!

#PhDLife #LLMAgents #UniversitÃ©DeMontrÃ©al #SoftwareEngineering #GEODES #ModelDrivenEngineering
entry.summary: Starting a new academic chapter under the supervision of Prof. Houari Sahraoui and Prof. Michalis Famelis at GEODES, DIRO â€“ UniversitÃ© de MontrÃ©al.

entry.title: An Unforgettable Journey to China with Huawei

link.title: An Unforgettable Journey to China with Huawei

entry.content:
Recently, I had the incredible opportunity to travel to China as part of a cultural and educational trip organized by Huawei. This journey was not only an exploration of Chinese culture and cuisine but also a deep dive into the world of advanced technology.

The Journey Begins

Our adventure started at the International Airport of Ouagadougou. From there, we flew to Charles de Gaulle Airport in Paris, then to Shanghai, and finally arrived in Beijing. The long journey was filled with anticipation and excitement for the experiences ahead.

Starting our journey from Ouagadougou and arriving in Beijing, we were so tired after the long flight that we slept on the bus on the way to our hotel.

Cultural Immersion

Upon our arrival in Beijing, we were greeted with warm hospitality. The first few days were dedicated to exploring the city and its rich history. We visited iconic landmarks, tasted delicious local dishes, and experienced the vibrant culture that China has to offer. We also took some courses on Chinese culture, which helped us understand the traditions and values that shape the lives of the people here.

Plus the language courses we had another opportunity to learn some basic Mandarin phrases, chinese calligraphy and even some traditional Chinese painting techniques. These experiences enriched our understanding of the culture and allowed us to connect with the local people on a deeper level.

Enjoying authentic Chinese cuisine and learning about the culture through food.

Exploring Beijing

We spent a week in Beijing, immersing ourselves in the rich Chinese culture. We visited historical sites, enjoyed authentic Chinese cuisine, and even learned some basic Mandarin phrases. The cityâ€™s vibrant atmosphere and deep-rooted traditions left a lasting impression on all of us.

Shenzhen and Huawei

After our cultural week in Beijing, we traveled to Shenzhen, where we visited various Huawei installations. The highlight of our trip was a bootcamp focused on cutting-edge technologies such as 5G, Big Data, AI, and IoT. We gained invaluable insights and hands-on experience in these fields.

Visiting Huawei installations and participating in the technology bootcamp.

The Grand Finale

Our trip concluded with a memorable ceremony night where we received our certificates of completion. It was a proud moment for all of us, celebrating our newfound knowledge and experiences.

The certificate ceremony marking the end of our enriching journey.

Returning Home

Upon our return to Ouagadougou, we were honored to meet with the Ministry of Innovation, some staff of the ministry, the CEO of Huawei Burkina, and the Ambassador of China in Burkina Faso. It was a wonderful opportunity to share our experiences and discuss potential collaborations.

This trip was an unforgettable blend of cultural immersion and technological exploration. I am grateful for the opportunity and look forward to applying what I have learned in my future endeavors.
entry.summary: Exploring Chinese culture and technology with Huawei
